com.hoovler.api.controllers

Class GameController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.hoovler.api.controllers.GameController

  • @RestController
 @RequestMapping(value="/namegame/v2.0.0")
public class GameController
extends java.lang.Object
    The sole controller for the NameGameApi, handling all RESTful service requests for, or affecting, any NameGame-related operation on the PlayerDao, QuestionDao, and ProfileDao resources.

    Two items remain the same: providing no header/URI params for list resources still returns all objects in the related repository, and providing an integer value for the start parameter will skip over start number of items before aggregating the returned list; however, a special note is warrented for those endpoints for which a list of objects may be returned.

    All list-returning endpoints now include three numeric subsetting header / URI parameters: start. stop, and velocity.

    Parameter: int start

    The start parameter (default=0) is the literal starting index of the list returned. This value may be positive, 0, or negative.

    If negative, then the startIndex is presumed to be |start| number of players from the end of the list of players, and is calculated as startIndex = players.size() - Math.abs(start).

    Parameter: int velocity

    The value of velocity is interpreted as a non-scalar value containing both a magnitude and direction.

    magnitude is calculated as Math.abs(velocity), and determines the length of the returned list.

    direction is calculated as Integer.signum(velocity). A value of -1 is interpreted as LEFT, +1 as RIGHT, and 0 as NONE.

    Effect of Parameters

    Think of the entire list as being a chain of player objects that is curled into a ring; where the last player is brought back around to connect with the first. If the magnitude (total number of subset elements) is greater than the length of the entire original list, then an iterator grabbing list elements for the subset simply returns to the first element after adding the last. There is no limit to the number of loops / full lists, so use velocity wisely.

    The derived velocity.direction determines whether to iterate forward or backwards from the startIndex, while velocity.magnitude determines how far to move in that direction. The subset will continue building - even after the last or first element is reached - until the subset size reaches the value of magnitude.

    See the underlying utility function, com.hoovler.utils.impl.ListUtils.subset() for more information on how the subset is derived.

    Context of Combinations

      Author:
      github.com/hoovler
    • start and start: Both values must be positive integers. If stop > returnList.size(), then stop is recast as returnList.size() - 1
    • start and velocity: Either value may be a positive or a negative integer. If Math.abs(velocity) > returnList.size() && velocity < 0, then returnList() will contain the full list in reverse, and as many repeating full reverse lists / elements in reverse as necessary to meet the absolute value (magnitude) of velocity. If the direction is positive (velocity < 0, the the returned list will be in the forward direction.
    • start and stop and velocity: only the value of start and stop are used.

      • Method Detail

        • ask

          @GetMapping(path="/ask")
public AskResponseBody ask(@RequestParam(value="email",defaultValue="")
                                                     java.lang.String email,
                                                     @RequestParam(value="reverse",defaultValue="false")
                                                     java.lang.String reverse,
                                                     @RequestParam(value="matts",defaultValue="false")
                                                     java.lang.String mattsOnly)
          The endpoint that generates and returns a question object. The only required parameter is email.

          For the boolean parameter, acceptable values for true = "1", "y", "yes", "t", "true", ... and so on, regardless of case. They can also be left off the list of arguments for a default value of FALSE for both.

          Parameters:
          email - the email of the player asking the question.
          reverse - a value of TRUE / FALSE
        • FALSE || null to show one face and six names
        • TRUE to show one name and six faces.
          • mattsOnly - a value of TRUE / FALSE
        • FALSE || null to pull the target and options from the pool of all profiles.
        • TRUE to use only the subset of profiles wherein the Profile.firstName starts with "mat", regardless of case. [regex = [m|M][a|A][t|T]]
          • Returns:
          the ask question

        • answer

          @PostMapping(path="/answer")
public AnswerResponseBody answer(@RequestBody
                                                               java.lang.String payload)
          The endpoint that accepts a POST request body with a valid JSON answer, and returns a boolean indicating if the answer was correct, and a Player object corresponding to the JSON body's email value, along with updated player stats.

          If an invalid request body is posted (malformed JSON, no body, bad JSON attribute names...), this endpoint will not throw an error. Rather, it will respond with a well-formed JSON response body in which are empty objects, "correct": "false", and a message indicating the nature of the problem.

          Parameters:
          payload - the well-formed JSON representation of the AnswerArgs object model, which contains email, answer_id, and question_id.
          Returns:
          a well-formed JSON response body in which is a Player object with updated stats, correct boolean indicating if the answer is correct, and message, which gives more information if there was a problem with the payload.

          • com.hoovler.utils.impl.SecurityUtils

          And an example configuration file: src/main/resources/security.config

          Diagnostic: Players.

          Return a list of all Player objects, representing the full list of players to whom a question has been asked.

          This diagnostic endpoint should be protected from casual players. A security configuration methodology template is provided in the general-utils maven project, within the following classes:

          • com.hoovler.utils.impl.SecurityUtils
          • com.hoovler.utils.models.SecurityConfig
          And an example configuration file: src/main/resources/security.config

          Note: To subset this list, simply use the /leaders endpoint with parameters.

          Parameters:
          start - the start
          stop - the stop
          velocity - the velocity
          Returns:
          the array list

        • questionsAsked

          @RequestMapping(path="/questions/pared")
public java.util.ArrayList<AskResponseBody> questionsAsked(@RequestParam(value="question_id",defaultValue="")
                                                                                                     java.lang.String qId,
                                                                                                     @RequestParam(value="start",defaultValue="0")
                                                                                                     java.lang.String start,
                                                                                                     @RequestParam(value="stop",defaultValue="0")
                                                                                                     java.lang.String stop,
                                                                                                     @RequestParam(value="velocity",defaultValue="0")
                                                                                                     java.lang.String velocity)
          Diagnostic: Pared Questions.

          DIAGNOSTIC ENDPOINT

          Returns a list of the questions as presented to the consumer of the /ask endpoint.

          While this list and the list available at the /questions endpoint are technically the same set of questions, these questions are pared down such that a user doesn't see the target_id of the target, which corresponds to a matching option_id in the options set.

          Note on velocity

          The value of velocity is interpreted as a non-scalar value containing both a magnitude and direction. magnitude is calculated as Math.abs(velocity), and determines the length of the returned list. direction is calculated as Integer.signum(velocity). A value of -1 is interpreted as LEFT, +1 as RIGHT, and 0 as NONE.

          The velocity is indended to be used in the stead of stop. If both stop and velocity are provided, the value of stop is used, and velocity is ignored.

          Parameters:
          qId - the q id
          start - the start
          stop - the index at which to end the subset.
          velocity - an integer denoting magnitude and direction. See above.
          Returns:
          the array list
